alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 10:53PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Crooked Creek near Norcross affecting Gwinnett and Fulton Counties. Nancy Creek at Johnson Ferry Road at Chamblee affecting DeKalb and Fulton Counties. Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nancy Creek at Johnson Ferry Road at Chamblee. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands and athletic fields occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Johnson Ferry Road. The water level will be hitting the pedestrian and vehicular bridges to the visitor parking lots on the Marist High School campus. This may cause some backwater and erosion eddies to form to the sides of the bridges. Minor flooding of residential yards will likely begin downstream to Rickenbacker Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 930 AM EDT.
